intro: Phacelia vossii, commonly known as Voss's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Phacelia vossii is often found in open areas with full sun exposure.
